Vincia: activity diagrams annotations grammar
Last Published: 02 June 2013  

zooming (actions)

Some actions are primary and some other secondary. There is a zooming option to indicate it.

annotation

...
//$0 action 1
code [note: undocumented in the detailed zoom]
//$1 action 1.1
code
//$1 action 1.2
code
//$0 action 2
...

0 is optional, corresponds to the main actions.

representation in the diagram

Note: try mouse over. This is the website visualization. In the tool, zooming could be on mouse click.

examples

int class::activity_method(){

int a;      

//$ action 1
int b=1;
int c=2;
//$1 action 1.1
std::cout << "do"<< b << endl;
//$1 action 1.2
std::cout << "do"<< c << endl;

//$0 action 2
std::cin >> a;

return 0;
}


Note: try mouse over. This is the website visualization. In the tool, zooming could be on mouse click.

operational implementation

A full diagram will contain in general several zoomable sections. For each of these sections, a certain zoom level choice gets assigned a certain code. Hence, a particular instance of a full diagram, as selected by the user, will contain a unique combination of these codes. Hyperlinks will connect among different instances (code combinations) of the same full diagram. Either:
1) The GUI browser sends a message to the diagram constructor to tell the latter what diagram exactly we want to see. REAL-TIME GENERATION (can save memory / space / time)
2) All possible diagrams are built beforehand. OFF-LINE GENERATION.
